paper_abstract: A real-valued finitely additive measure mu on N is said to be a measure of statistical type provided mu(k) = 0 for all singletons {k}. Applying the classical representation theorem of finitely additive measures with totally bounded variation, we first present a short proof of the representation theorem of statistical measures. As its application, we show that every kind of statistical convergence is just a type of measure convergence with respect to a specific class of statistical measures. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On real-valued measures of statistical type and their applications to statistical convergence
